cards.back:
Are we solving the equations correctly?

• Checks mathematical accuracy
• Compares to exact/manufactured solutions
• Finds code bugs and numerical errors

Do the equations represent reality?

• Checks physical accuracy
• Compares to measurements
• Finds missing physics and wrong assumptions

u_exact ≈ u_h/2 + (u_h/2 - u_h)/(2^p - 1)

Where:
• u_h = solution at step size h
• p = order of accuracy

Also gives error estimate:
ε ≈ (u_h/2 - u_h)/(2^p - 1)

p = ln(e_h/e_h/2) / ln(2)

Or using three grids:
p = ln[(u_h - u_h/2)/(u_h/2 - u_h/4)] / ln(2)

Compare to expected order to verify code

For independent sources:

u_total = √(u₁² + u₂² + u₃² + ...)

Root-Sum-Square (RSS) method

1. Choose smooth test function u_m
2. Substitute into equations: L[u_m] = f_m
3. Solve modified problem with source f_m
4. Compare numerical solution to u_m

Advantage: Works without analytical solution

GCI_fine = F_s × |u_h/2 - u_h| / (r^p - 1)

Where:
• F_s ≈ 1.25 (safety factor)
• r = refinement ratio (usually 2)
• p = order of accuracy

Provides 95% confidence error band

1. Experimental measurement (Gold)
2. Independent validated simulation (Silver)
3. Analytical solutions (Bronze)
4. Physical intuition (Sanity check only)

Higher = more trustworthy evidence

cards.front: What verification finds vs validation finds
cards.back:
Verification finds:
• Code bugs
• Numerical errors
• Solver convergence issues
• Implementation mistakes

Validation finds:
• Missing physics
• Wrong assumptions
• Parameter errors
• Model applicability limits

Answers: Which inputs most affect the output?

Normalized sensitivity:
S* = (p/y) × (∂y/∂p)

Interpretation: 1% change in p causes S*% change in y

Helps prioritize which parameters to measure accurately

Model validated if:
|E| ≤ k × u_val

Where:
• E = simulation - measurement
• k = coverage factor (2 for 95%)
• u_val = √(u_num² + u_input² + u_meas²)

1. Verify FIRST (fix code bugs)
2. Validate SECOND (check physics)

Reason: No point validating buggy code!

"Never validate an unverified model"
